DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Lung Distant Metastasis Present Performed Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the the methods, procedures, and tests were performed to determine whether or not there is cancer that has spread from the lung to distant organs or distant lymph nodes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Lung Distant Metastasis Present Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose the presence of cancer that has spread from the lung to distant organs or distant lymph nodes being performed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:Refers to cancer that has spread from the original (primary) tumor to distant organs or distant lymph nodes.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

A biological process that involves the transfer and growth of cancer cells from the site of the primary tumor. Relocation of malignant cells during metastasis can be restricted to movement within a specific tissue/organ or may entail migration to a distal locus within the body. This phenotype is a characteristic of all malignant tumors.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
